title: Greek Yogurt with Berries
steps: In a bowl, add Greek yogurt.
Top with mixed berries and chia seeds.
Drizzle with honey if desired.
Mix and enjoy.
nutritionalBenefits: Rich in protein from Greek yogurt, antioxidants from berries, and omega-3 fatty acids from chia seeds. Supports muscle recovery and weight management.

title: Paneer Tikka
steps: Mix yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, cumin powder, garam masala, and salt to make a marinade.
Add paneer cubes, bell peppers, and onions to the marinade. Mix gently.
Marinate for at least 15 minutes.
Thread onto skewers and grill in an oven at 180°C for 10-12 minutes or cook on a non-stick pan until lightly charred.
Sprinkle chaat masala and serve hot.
nutritionalBenefits: High in protein from paneer, low in carbs, and provides essential nutrients from vegetables. Ideal for muscle building and weight management.

title: Sprouts Chaat
steps: Steam mixed sprouts for 5 minutes until tender but not mushy.
In a bowl, mix steamed sprouts, cucumber, tomato, and onion.
Add chaat masala, cumin powder, salt, and lemon juice. Mix well.
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves.
Serve immediately.
nutritionalBenefits: High in protein and fiber from sprouts, low in calories, and rich in vitamins and minerals from fresh vegetables. Perfect for weight loss and muscle maintenance.

title: Vegetable Sandwich
steps: Spread mint chutney on both slices of bread.
Layer cucumber, tomato, onion, and bell pepper on one slice.
Sprinkle black pepper and salt.
Cover with the other slice of bread.
Toast in a sandwich maker or on a pan until golden brown.
Cut into triangles and serve.
nutritionalBenefits: Complex carbohydrates from whole grain bread, fiber from vegetables, and low in calories. A balanced snack for sustained energy.

title: Fruit and Nut Mix
ingredients: 1/4 cup mixed seasonal fruits (apple, pear, orange), chopped
steps: In a bowl, mix chopped fruits and nuts.
Sprinkle chia seeds and cinnamon powder.
Drizzle honey if desired.
Mix well and enjoy.
nutritionalBenefits: Rich in fiber, vitamins, and minerals from fruits, with healthy fats and protein from nuts. Provides sustained energy and supports overall health.

title: Roasted Makhana (Fox Nuts)
steps: Heat ghee in a pan.
Add makhana and roast on low heat until crisp, stirring continuously.
Add black pepper, cumin powder, and salt. Mix well.
Cool and store in an airtight container.
Enjoy as a crunchy snack.
nutritionalBenefits: Low in calories, high in protein and fiber. A healthy alternative to fried snacks, perfect for weight loss.

title: Cucumber and Carrot Sticks with Hummus
steps: Arrange cucumber and carrot sticks on a plate.
In a small bowl, mix hummus with black pepper and lemon juice.
Serve vegetables with hummus for dipping.
nutritionalBenefits: Low in calories, high in fiber from vegetables, with protein and healthy fats from hummus. A refreshing and satisfying snack.

title: Buttermilk with Spices
steps: Blend yogurt and water until smooth.
Add cumin powder, black salt, black pepper, and grated ginger. Mix well.
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves.
Serve chilled.
nutritionalBenefits: Rich in probiotics from yogurt, aids digestion, and provides calcium. A refreshing and hydrating snack.

title: Baked Sweet Potato Wedges
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C.
Wash and cut sweet potato into wedges.
In a bowl, toss sweet potato wedges with olive oil, paprika, garlic powder, and salt.
Arrange on a baking tray and bake for 20-25 minutes until crisp.
Serve hot.
nutritionalBenefits: Rich in complex carbohydrates, fiber, and beta-carotene. A healthier alternative to fried snacks, perfect for post-workout recovery.

title: Oats and Vegetable Cutlet
ingredients: 1/4 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, beans), finely chopped and boiled
steps: Dry roast oats for 2-3 minutes and grind coarsely.
In a bowl, mix ground oats, boiled vegetables, mashed potato, besan, cumin powder, garam masala, coriander leaves, and salt.
Shape into small cutlets.
Heat a non-stick pan and spread a little oil.
Cook cutlets on medium heat until golden brown on both sides.
Serve hot with mint chutney.
nutritionalBenefits: Good source of complex carbohydrates from oats, fiber from vegetables, and protein from besan. A satisfying snack that keeps hunger at bay.

title: Energy Balls
steps: Soak dates in warm water for 15 minutes. Drain.
In a food processor, blend dates, oats, chia seeds, peanut butter, cocoa powder, and cinnamon until it forms a sticky dough.
Roll into small balls.
Refrigerate for 30 minutes before serving.
Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.
nutritionalBenefits: Natural sugars from dates provide quick energy, while oats and chia seeds offer sustained release. Protein from peanut butter supports muscle function.

title: Apple with Almond Butter
steps: Slice the apple.
Spread almond butter on apple slices or use as a dip.
Enjoy immediately.
nutritionalBenefits: Quick source of carbohydrates and fiber from apple, with protein and healthy fats from almond butter. A balanced pre-workout snack.

title: Coconut Water with Chia Seeds
steps: Mix chia seeds in coconut water and let it sit for 10 minutes.
Add lemon juice and a pinch of salt. Mix well.
Serve chilled.
nutritionalBenefits: Natural electrolytes from coconut water support hydration, while chia seeds provide omega-3 fatty acids and protein. Perfect for pre-workout hydration.

title: Paneer and Fruit Bowl
steps: In a bowl, mix paneer cubes and chopped fruits.
Drizzle honey if desired.
Sprinkle cinnamon powder.
Mix gently and enjoy.
nutritionalBenefits: High in protein from paneer, with carbohydrates from fruits for glycogen replenishment. A balanced post-workout snack.

title: Chickpea and Vegetable Salad
steps: In a bowl, mix chickpeas, cucumber, tomato, and bell pepper.
Add lemon juice, cumin powder, and salt. Mix well.
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves.
Serve immediately.
nutritionalBenefits: Protein from chickpeas, with fiber and vitamins from vegetables. A refreshing and nutritious post-workout snack.

title: Yogurt with Honey and Nuts
steps: In a bowl, add yogurt.
Drizzle honey and sprinkle chopped nuts.
Add cinnamon powder.
Mix and enjoy.
nutritionalBenefits: Protein and probiotics from yogurt, with healthy fats from nuts. Supports muscle recovery and gut health.
